definition[0]: if an event goes your way, it happens in the way you want
note[0]: everything/nothing goes somebody’s way (=used to talk about events in general)
example[0]: The government are hopeful that the vote will go their way.
definition[1]: to continue a journey, or to leave and do what you want to do next
example[1]: She said goodbye and went her way.
definition[2]: to travel in the same direction as someone
example[2]: I can take you – I’m going your way.
